description: Demolition of existing retail store and redevelopment to provide ground and part first floor retail unit with 131 flats above, comprising 4-storey residential above retail unit (fronting The Broadway) and 8-storey residential above ground and mezzanine parking (fronting Singapore Road), servicing, landscaping and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with adopted policies B1 and B5 and replacement UDP policy 4.1. | Details of refuse storage shown on the approved plans, as modified by the provisions of Condition 16, shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies H34, 4.1 and 5.5. | The ground and part first floor of the premises identified on the approved drawings as retail store, storage and staff facilities shall be used as non-food retail and ancillary retail use and for no other purpose including food-retail within Class A1 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the traffic conditions in the locality, in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies T49 and 9.1. | The shop window displays on Broadway and Singapore Road shall be retained and used for display purposes and not be painted over or otherwise obscured.  REASON:  To maintain the retail character of the shopping area within which the site is situated, and in the interest of the streetscene, in accordance with adopted policies UDP B12, B13, and RUDP 4.10. | Before the development commences detailed drawings of the design and external appearance of the shopfronts including the fascia and provision for disabled people to gain access to the premises, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and the details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation.  REASON:  In the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and to ensure adequate access is provided for people with disabilities, in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies UDP B12, B13, and RUDP 4.10. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON:  To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with adopted UDP polices B2 and ES4 and Replacement UDP policy 4.5. | The City Car Club shall be established prior to occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: In the interest of traffic conditions of the local area, in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies T40 and 9.1 | On first occupation of the development, the Green Travel Plan, dated March 2003 as amended and contained within the Fifth Schedule of the S106 Agreement associated with this permission, shall be implemented and complied with thereafter, and targets within the plan shall be subject to monitoring by the LPA on an annual basis or timetable as otherwise agreed with the LPA.  REASON: To minimise car use and promote alternative modes of travel for residents, staff and visitors to and from the site in accordance with the Council's sustainable development policies and RUDP 9.1. | Before any works commence on site, details of cycle parking in accordance with the Council's standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with adopted and UDP policies T15 and 9.6. | Notwithstanding details shown on drawing number 2044 P 1F received 15/4/03, details of a plan showing the position of the 6 parking bays to be allocated for City Car Club shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for City Car Club car parking within the site, in accordance with adopted UDP policy T40 and T56 and Replacement UDP policy 9.1 and 9.8. | The car parking space(s) shown on the approved plans, 2044 P1F received 15/4/03 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking, and shall not be used for any other purpose.  REASON:  To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with adopted UDP policy T40 and T56 and Replacement UDP policy 9.1. | The areas shown on the approved plans as parking, access, loading, unloading and manoeuvring areas for servicing shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only.  REASON:  To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies T43, T44 and 9.11 | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority within four weeks of the date of implementation of the permission hereby granted, and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of any part of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, ES3 & H12; Replacement Plan policies 4.1, 4.3 & 5.3. | The development will be affected by traffic noise at a level which falls into Categories B, C and D noise exposure.  Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens and balconies from external noise and vibration, and sensitive rooms from internal building services noise.  The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at Document 5.3 "Guidance for developers".  The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works, as approved, shall be completed before occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the properties in accordance with adopted and replacement UDP policies B8 and 4.11. | Notwithstanding details shown on drawing number 2044 P 1F received 15/4/03, details of a plan, showing a reduction in the size of the residents bin store adjacent to the service road to provide a minimum of 1.8m clear footway width to be achieved, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON: In the interest of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies  T62, 9.5 and 9.1 | Notwithstanding details shown on drawing number 2044 P 1F received 15/4/03, details of a plan showing visibility splays at locations of potential conflict between vehicles and pedestrians shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON: In the interest of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies  T62, 9.5 and 9.1 | Development shall not begin until drainage works have been carried out in accordance with details to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority; the scheme as approved to be carried out before any part of the development permitted is occupied.  REASON: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with adopted and RUDP policies R10 and 2.5. | Details of the design of the building and car/cycle and parking area, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas aiming to comply with the requirements of Secure By Design shall be submitted for approval to the Local Planning Authority within four weeks of the date of implementation of the permission hereby granted. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of any part of the development ,and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy B20; Replacement Plan policies 4.3 & 4.4. | No deliveries to the retail unit shall take place outside the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Saturdays and not at all on Sundays and Bank Holidays.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy ES5; Replacement Plan policy 4.11. | The hours of operation of the retail units shall be restricted to 08:00 to 21:00 every day of the week.  REASON: In the interests of living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policy ES5; Replacement Plan policy 4.11. | Details of vertical and horizontal acoustic separation between the second floor plant room with walls, floors and ceilings of residential accommodation and details of horizontal acoustic separation between the ground floor retail servicing area with floors of residential accommodation above shall be submitted to and approved by the LPA prior to commencement of development. Details shall be implemented as approved and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the site, in accordance with adopted UDP policy B8 and RUDP policy 4.11.
